meanings.definition: Fibronectins: A glycoprotein that helps cells attach to the extracellular matrix.
meanings.sent1: The fibronectins in our body assist cells in sticking to the matrix.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how fibronectins aid cell attachment to surfaces.
meanings.sent3: The fibronectins at the party were the glue holding everyone together.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acted like fibronectins, binding people closer.
meanings.sent5: Imagine fibronectins as tiny helpers ensuring cells stay put.

meanings.definition: Fibronectins: Proteins involved in cell adhesion and migration.
meanings.sent1: Cell adhesion relies on the fibronectins present.
meanings.sent2: The body uses fibronectins for cell movement within tissues.
meanings.sent3: The fibronectins at the gym were always on the move.
meanings.sent4: In the crowded city, people flowed like fibronectins in the bloodstream.
meanings.sent5: The fibronectins acted as guides, leading cells to their destinations.

meanings.definition: Fibronectins: Play a role in wound healing and tissue repair.
meanings.sent1: Wound healing benefits from the fibronectins produced.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how fibronectins aid in tissue restoration.
meanings.sent3: The fibronectins in the story magically fixed everything.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like fibronectins, soothing and repairing broken hearts.
meanings.sent5: The fibronectins worked tirelessly, patching up any damage they encountered.
